intro: Collinsia tinctoria, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or yellow flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
